titles.title: To provide for the adjustment of status for certain long-term conditional residents.
To provide for the adjustment of status for certain long-term conditional residents.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to direct the Secretary of Homeland Security (DHS) to adjust an alien's status from conditional resident to lawful permanent resident if such person: (1) became a conditional resident as an alien entrepreneur, alien spouse, or alien child on or before December 31, 1998; (2) filed an application to remove conditional resident status on an I-829 form on or before December 31, 2000; and (3) had such form or a motion to reopen or reconsider the denial of such form pending before DHS as of the date of the enactment of this Act.
